I want to read it, but gather its not exactly beginners level. I've studied some (neoclassical) economics at uni. The introductions to 'keynesianism' which I have come across seem to be the neoclasical synthesis - which I gather is not very representative of the real keynes.
 
 Any recomendations? Cheers.
It is not that difficult, but unless you are jsut into mental masturbation, reading the wikipedia article and finding a "for dummies" version will give you enough of it to understand the high points.

Really? I'm reading it because I'm interested in the postkeynesian shool. Also, because it was summarised after keynes death in such a way as to take much of keynes theory out to ensure it was compatable with neoclassical orthodoxy - this summary being taught as 'keynesianism'.
